definition[0]: to deal with problems or a confused situation and make it better, especially by organizing things
example[0]: There are several financial problems that need to be straightened out quickly.
definition[1]: to become straight, or to make something straight
example[1]: The path soon bends to the right, then straightens out.
definition[2]: to improve your bad behaviour or deal with personal problems, or to help someone do this
example[3]: He straightened out when he joined the army.
example[4]: Her parents changed her school, hoping it would straighten her out.
